you.notes: **grace be to you**  - The word "you" refers to all the believers at Ephesus.

you.quote: I urge you to live a life worthy of the calling
you.notes: **I urge you to live a life worthy of the calling** - In all these verses the word "you" refers to all the believers at Ephesus. AT: "I encourage with you to conduct yourself in a manner proper of the calling"

activepassive.quote: May the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ be praised
activepassive.notes: **May the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ be praised**  - This could be worded in the active form. AT: "Let us praise the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ"
**until the possession is gained** - AT: "until we gain possession of our inheritance"

activepassive.quote: there will be made known to the rulers and authorities in the heavenly places through the Church the complex wisdom of God
activepassive.notes: **there will be made known to the rulers and authorities in the heavenly places through the Church the complex wisdom of God** - AT: "God will make his complex wisdom known to the rulers and authorities in the heavenly places through the Church"

activepassive.quote: To each one of us has been given a gift
activepassive.notes: **To each one of us has been given a gift** - AT: "A gift has been given to each believer" or "God gave a gift to each one of us"

activepassive.quote: Let all bitterness...be taken away from you
activepassive.notes: **Let all bitterness...be taken away from you** - AT: "Let God take away all feelings of hostility" or "Let God take away all feelings of hatred"

activepassive.quote: that the message might be given to me
activepassive.notes: **that the message might be given to me** - AT: "that God might give me the word" or "God might give me the message"

inclusive.notes: **has blessed us **  - This is an inclusive pronoun referring to Paul and all the believers at Ephesus.
**predestined us**  - Paul was including himself, the Ephesian church and all believers in Christ in his use of "us."
**we have redemption** - "We" refers to all believers.
**come from us** - The pronoun "us" refers to Paul and all the believers at Ephesus.

inclusive.quote: we are God's workmanship, created in Christ Jesus
inclusive.notes: **we are God's workmanship, created in Christ Jesus** - The pronoun "we" refers to Paul and all the believers at Ephesus. AT: "God has created us as new people joined to Christ Jesus"
**divided us from each other** - "Us" refers to both Paul and the Ephesians, that separated the Jewish believers from the Gentile believers.

inclusive.quote: For through Jesus we both have access
inclusive.notes: **For through Jesus we both have access** - "We both" refers to both Paul, the believing Jews and the believing non-Jews.
**that we ask or think** - "We" includes Paul and his audience.
**To each one of us** - The word "us" includes Paul and all the believers at Ephesus.

inclusive.quote: we are members of each other
inclusive.notes: **we are members of each other** - AT: "we are all members of God's family"

inclusive.quote: we are members of his body
inclusive.notes: **we are members of his body** - The word "we" refers to Paul and all the believers.

doublet.quote: so we could be holy and blameless
doublet.notes: **so we could be holy and blameless**  -  Paul states two traits that we can become in God.
**your trespasses and your sins** - The words "trespasses" and "sins" mean basically the same thing. Paul uses them together to emphasize the greatness of the people's sin.
**rulers and authorities** - These words share similar meanings. Paul uses them together to emphasize that every spiritual being will know God's wisdom.
**rage and anger** - The words "rage" and "anger" express the great intensity of anger. AT: "uncontrolled anger"
**shouting and insults** - The word "shouting" intensifies the harshness of "insults." AT: "harsh verbal abuse"
**without stain or wrinkle** - Paul speaks of the Church as a garment that is clean and in good condition. He uses the same idea in two ways to emphasize the Church's purity.
**holy and without fault** - The phrase "without fault" means basically the same thing as "holy." Paul uses the two together to emphasize the Church's purity.
**deep respect and trembling** - These are two similar ways to show honor towards one's master.

exclusive.quote: we were chosen...we who were the first
exclusive.notes: **we were chosen...we who were the first** - The word "we" now refers to Paul, his Jewish brothers in Christ but not the Gentile (non-Jewish) believers.
**we who were the first ** - Paul continues to exclude the Gentiles (non-Jews) from his use of "we."

metaphor.quote: were sealed with the promised Holy Spirit
metaphor.notes: **were sealed with the promised Holy Spirit** - As wax was placed on a letter and impressed with a symbol representing who sent the letter, God sealed our salvation with the Holy Spirit signifying his ownership of us.

metaphor.quote: has made him the head...which is his body
metaphor.notes: **has made him the head...which is his body** - Just as with a human body, the head rules all things pertaining to its body, so is Christ the head of the church body.

metaphor.quote: the head over all things in the Church
metaphor.notes: **the head over all things in the Church**  - "Head" implies the leader or the one in charge. AT: "ruler over all things in the Church"

metaphor.quote: which is his body
metaphor.notes: **which is his body**  - The Church is often referred to as the body of Christ.

metaphor.quote: And you were dead in your trespasses and your sins
metaphor.notes: **And you were dead in your trespasses and your sins**  - This shows how sinful people are unable to obey God in the same way a dead person is unable to respond physically.

metaphor.quote: while we were dead in trespasses, he brought us to new life
metaphor.notes: **while we were dead in trespasses, he brought us to new life** - This shows how a sinful person is unable to obey God until he is given new spiritual life just like a dead person is unable to respond physically unless he is raised from the dead.

metaphor.quote: you Gentiles are no longer strangers and foreigners, but instead you are fellow citizens with those set apart for God, those who are members of God's family
metaphor.notes: **you Gentiles are no longer strangers and foreigners, but instead you are fellow citizens with those set apart for God, those who are members of God's family**  - This is describing the spiritual condition of Gentiles before and after they became believers in the same way as a non-citizen becomes a citizen of a nation.

metaphor.quote: These are built upon the foundation...
metaphor.notes: **These are built upon the foundation...**  - Paul compares God's family to a building. Christ being the cornerstone, the apostles being the foundation, and the believers being the structure.

metaphor.quote: the whole building of his family fits together and increases as a temple set apart for the Lord
metaphor.notes: **the whole building of his family fits together and increases as a temple set apart for the Lord**  - Paul continues with the comparison of Christ's family to a building in the way a builder fits stones in the making a building so Christ is fitting us together.

metaphor.quote: in whom you also are being built together into a dwelling place for God in the Spirit
metaphor.notes: **in whom you also are being built together into a dwelling place for God in the Spirit**  - This describes how believers are being put together to become a place where God will permanently dwell in the Spirit just as a house is a dwelling place for people on earth.

metaphor.quote: that you be rooted and grounded in his love
metaphor.notes: **that you be rooted and grounded in his love**  - Paul compares their faith like a tree that has deep roots or a house build on a solid foundation. AT: "that you will be like a firmly rooted tree and a building founded upon stone"

metaphor.quote: one body
metaphor.notes: **one body** - All believers in the family of God are like the various members of a human body.

metaphor.quote: for the building up of the body of Christ
metaphor.notes: **for the building up of the body of Christ** - This metaphor compares growing spiritually to doing exercises to increase the strength of the human body.

metaphor.quote: reach complete adulthood
metaphor.notes: **reach complete adulthood** - AT: "become mature believers"

metaphor.quote: be like children
metaphor.notes: **be like children** - This is comparing a believer who has not grown spiritually to a child who has had very little experience in life.

metaphor.quote: tossed around and carried away by every wind of teaching
metaphor.notes: **tossed around and carried away by every wind of teaching** - This metaphor compares a believer who has not become mature and hears wrong teaching to a boat that is being blown by the wind in random directions on the water.

metaphor.quote: into him who is the head...in the body's growth
metaphor.notes: **into him who is the head...in the body's growth** - This is a metaphor using the human body to describe how Christ causes believers to work together in harmony like the head of a body causes the body parts to work together to grow healthy.

metaphor.quote: you must put off the old man
metaphor.notes: **you must put off the old man** - You must rid yourself of all sinful behavior just like taking off clothes and throwing them away. AT: "you must change your behavior"

metaphor.quote: so that you may put on the new man
metaphor.notes: **so that you may put on the new man**  - This shows how an unbeliever becomes a new person when he becomes a believer by the power of God, just as a person puts on new clothing and looks totally different.

metaphor.quote: For you were once darkness
metaphor.notes: **For you were once darkness** - Just as one can not see in the dark, so people who live in sin lack spiritual understanding.

metaphor.quote: but now you are light in the Lord
metaphor.notes: **but now you are light in the Lord** - Just as one can see in the light, so people who live in righteousness have spiritual understanding.

metaphor.quote: because the fruit of the light is all goodness, righteousness, and truth
metaphor.notes: **because the fruit of the light is all goodness, righteousness, and truth** - The works coming from the life of a believer (goodness, righteousness, and truth) are like the good fruit produced by a healthy tree.

metaphor.quote: the unfruitful works of the darkness
metaphor.notes: **the unfruitful works of the darkness** - The works of someone living in spiritual darkness are like the evil actions of people who do evil works hidden by the darkness at night.

metaphor.quote: Everything is revealed by the light
metaphor.notes: **Everything is revealed by the light** - Just as light reveals things that were hidden in the physical world, so the light of Christ reveals the evil spiritual actions of unbelievers in the spiritual world.

metaphor.quote: Awake, you who sleep, and rise from the dead
metaphor.notes: **Awake, you who sleep, and rise from the dead** - Unbelievers need to wake up from being dead spiritually just as a person who has died must come alive again in order to respond.

metaphor.quote: Christ will shine on you
metaphor.notes: **Christ will shine on you** - Christ will enable an unbeliever to understand his provision of forgiveness and new life just as light shows what is actually there that was hidden by darkness.

metaphor.quote: he cleansed us by the washing of water by the word
metaphor.notes: **he cleansed us by the washing of water by the word** - Possible meanings are 1) Paul is referring to having been made clean by God's word and through water baptism in Christ or 2) Paul is saying God made us spiritually clean from our sins by the word of God like we make our bodies clean by washing with water.

metaphor.quote: we are members of his body
metaphor.notes: **we are members of his body** - Possible meanings are 1) "we are members of his body of believers" (non-metaphorical sense) or 2) Believers fit together to form the body of Christ just as the parts of the human body fit together to form a person.

metaphor.quote: Put on the whole armor of God, that you may be able to stand against the scheming plans of the devil
metaphor.notes: **Put on the whole armor of God, that you may be able to stand against the scheming plans of the devil** - Christians should use all the resources God gives to stand firm against the devil just as a soldier puts on armor to protect himself from enemy attacks.

metaphor.quote: Therefore put on the whole armor of God
metaphor.notes: **Therefore put on the whole armor of God** - Christians should use the protective resources God gives them in fighting the devil in the same way a soldier puts on armor to protect himself against his enemies.

metaphor.quote: the belt of truth
metaphor.notes: **the belt of truth** - Truth holds everything together for a believer just as a belt holds all clothing of a soldier together.

metaphor.quote: the breastplate of righteousness
metaphor.notes: **the breastplate of righteousness** - The gift of righteousness covers a believer's heart just as a breastplate protects the chest of a soldier.

metaphor.quote: wear shoes on your feet that are prepared to proclaim the gospel of peace
metaphor.notes: **wear shoes on your feet that are prepared to proclaim the gospel of peace** - Just as a soldier wears shoes to give him solid footing, the believer must have solid knowledge of the gospel of peace in order to be ready to proclaim it.

metaphor.quote: always carrying the shield of faith
metaphor.notes: **always carrying the shield of faith** - The faith God gives a believer is to be used for protection when the devil attacks like a shield which a soldier uses to protect from enemy attacks.

metaphor.quote: the flaming arrows of the evil one
metaphor.notes: **the flaming arrows of the evil one** - The attacks of the devil against a believer are like flaming arrows shot at a soldier by an enemy.

metaphor.quote: And take the helmet of salvation
metaphor.notes: **And take the helmet of salvation** - Salvation given by God protects the believer's mind just as a helmet protects the head of a soldier.

metaphor.quote: the sword of the Spirit, which is the word of God
metaphor.notes: **the sword of the Spirit, which is the word of God** - The word of God, inspired by the Holy Spirit, is to be used to fight against and defend the believer from the devil just as a soldier uses his sword to fight and defend against enemy attacks.

doublenegatives.quote: I have not stopped thanking God
doublenegatives.notes: **I have not stopped thanking God** - This can be translated as a positive statement. AT: "I continue to thank God"

idiom.quote: that the eyes of your heart may be enlightened
idiom.notes: **that the eyes of your heart may be enlightened** - The phrase "eyes of your heart" expresses one's ability to  gain understanding. AT: "that you may gain understanding and be enlightened"

idiom.quote: seated him at his right hand
idiom.notes: **seated him at his right hand** - "seated Christ at God's right hand." This is the highest place of honor.
**you once walked** - This expresses the behavior of how people live. AT: "you once lived"
**flesh and blood** - This expression refers to people, in contrast to spirits who do not have human bodies.

metonymy.notes: **all things under Christ's feet **  - This represents Christ's lordship, authority and power. AT: "all things under Christ’s power"

metonymy.quote: according to the age of this world
metonymy.notes: **according to the age of this world**  - The apostles also used “world” to refer to the selfish behaviors and corrupt values of the people living in this world. AT: “according to the values of people living in the world” or “following the principles of this present world”

metonymy.quote: acted according to the evil desires of our flesh, doing the will of the flesh and of the mind
metonymy.notes: **acted according to the evil desires of our flesh, doing the will of the flesh and of the mind**  - The words "flesh" and "mind" are used as metonyms for the entire body.
**because the days are evil** - The word "days" means the times you are living in.

explicit.quote: For this I became a servant
explicit.notes: **For this I became a servant** - AT: "I am now serving God to spread the gospel"
**access with confidence** - AT: "access into God's presence with confidence" or "freedom to enter into God's presence with confidence"
**For this cause** - AT: "Because God has done all this for you"
**Christ gave gifts like these** - AT: "Christ gave gifts to the Church like these"

explicit.quote: So do not be participants with them
explicit.notes: **So do not be participants with them** - AT: "Be sure you do not participate with them in evil behavior"

explicit.quote: he is the Savior of the body
explicit.notes: **he is the Savior of the body** - AT: "Christ is the Savior of the body of believers" or "Christ is the Savior of all believers"

explicit.quote: so also must wives be to their husbands in everything
explicit.notes: **so also must wives be to their husbands in everything** - AT: "so wives must also be subject to their husbands in everything"
**as their own bodies** - AT: "as they love their own bodies"

youdual.quote: that it may be well with you, and you may live long on the earth
youdual.notes: **that it may be well with you, and you may live long on the earth** - The pronoun "you" refers to the children of Israel to whom Moses was speaking. AT: "so that you may prosper and live a long life on the earth"

parallelism.quote: be strong in the Lord and in the strength of his might
parallelism.notes: **be strong in the Lord and in the strength of his might** - AT: "depend completely on the Lord to give you spiritual strength"
